name: Oldies Guys Quiz | Names in Songs | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Cave-in.

	"At the bottom of that hole lies a big, big man ... Big John".By Jimmy Dean.

questions.text: In "Alfie" (sung by Dionne Warwick), she asks whether life belongs only to the ...?
questions.explanation:
Strong.

	From the Michael Caine movie.

Annette Funicello.

	Annette did the song back in the days when she seemed to be doing everything.

questions.text: What kind of knife did "Mack,the Knife" use?
questions.explanation:
Jackknife.

	"Just a jacknife has old Mack Heath, dear ..." Great job by Bobby Darin.

questions.text: Who sang "Billy, Don't Be a Hero"?
questions.explanation:
Bo Donaldson and the Haywoods.

	Poor Billy doesn't make it through the war. The English hit version was by Paper Lace.

questions.text: What does "Charlie Brown" call the English teacher?
questions.explanation:
Daddy-o.

	Light-hearted stuff from the Coasters.

questions.text: In "Leroy Brown", Leroy makes a mistake by getting involved with a particular woman. What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Doris.

	"At the edge of the bar sat a girl named Doris ..." . One of the better-known songs by Jim Croce.

questions.text: Where is the "King of the Road" going?
questions.explanation:
Maine.

	"Third Boxcar, midnight train, destination: BAngor, Maine". By Roger Miller.

Goldfinger.

	"A golden girl knows when he's kissed her/it's the kiss of death fromMr. Goldfinger ...". By Shirley Bassey.

questions.text: A toughie: Sue Thompson had a hit with which of these songs?
questions.explanation:
Norman.

	"Norman, oo oo oo oo oo ". (Ah, they don't write them like that any more.)
